body:
Comment 1: 
We should find a way to recompile external packages.
Installing them in a separate tree wouldn't really
help the situation, because you'd still have to find
a list of which directories were packages and which
were, well, directories.  It might not need to be part of
all.bash but just an easy-to-run command.

For example, if goinstall kept a local log of which packages
it had downloaded and installed, we could make 

goinstall -a

mean "reinstall all the packages".  This would also
help updating: goinstall -a -u could mean "update and
install all the packages".
